did.abstract: Watercolor art done on memos by Donald Mochon, founding director of the SUNY Albany Art Museum.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Donald Mochon was the founder of the University at Albany's Art Museum. Mochon graduated from the Rensselaer Polytehnic Institute with a Master of Architecture in 1938. Mochon went on to serve in the U.S. Navy from 1941-1945, and later became a professor at RPI. Mochon was named the first director of the Art Musuem at the University at Albany in 1966. Mochon died in 1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Dr. Francine Frank former Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences at the University at Albany donated materials to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 2015.
